intro: Peganon harmalum, commonly known as the African angelica, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often harvested for their aromatic properties and traditional medicinal uses. Peganon harmalum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
